page.title: 11RELIGIOUS DENOMINATIONS
page.content: In the area of study there are many churches of different denominations. In Casselbank Street, off Leith Walk three denominations are to be found - Baptist, Free Church and Pentecostal. In Sheriff Brae there is now a Sikh Temple in a building which was formerly a Church of Scotland. In Leith in the Kirkgate, we see South Leith Parish Church as one of the oldest churches in the area. Their church hall now stands on the site of the former St. Andrew's Church. In Junction Street there is a Methodist Church, part of which is up for sale, as well as a Church of Scotland. The United Free Church, also presbyterian, is to be found in Bangor Road. There is evidence of churches being closed;e.g. St Ninian's, Ferry Road, or amalgamated - Junction Road church has joined with St. Thomas'.
